author: cnbc.com
title: DexCom reports 4Q loss
text:
SAN DIEGO (AP) _ DexCom Inc. (DXCM) on Tuesday reported a loss of $9.4 million in its fourth quarter.
The San Diego-based company said it had a loss of 11 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for pretax expenses, were 10 cents per share.
The results beat Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of 11 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 3 cents per share.
The medical device company posted revenue of $221 million in the period, also exceeding Street forecasts. Seven analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $217.8 million.
For the year, the company reported that its loss narrowed to $50.2 million, or 58 cents per share. Revenue was reported as $718.5 million.
DexCom expects full-year revenue in the range of $830 million to $850 million.
DexCom shares have fallen 3 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Tuesday, shares hit $55.67, a decline of 30 percent in the last 12 months.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on DXCM at https://www.zacks.com/ap/DXCM
